The Associate Director for Operational Programs for the WIFIRE Lab directs the public and private operational programs in the WIFIRE Lab, and supports the Lab Director by identifying and enabling strategic research and application thrusts related to translating the research-driven products to operational use.  To do this, the incumbent will leverage and continue development of partnerships and collaborations with disaster response groups and agencies in public and private sectors to identify needs for research-based applications for disaster response in practice. 
The incumbent will also oversee integration of solutions for disaster response needs in operations to spatial data science infrastructure within the WIFIRE Lab, evaluate emerging technologies and industry offerings applicable to the Lab’s efforts in public/private partnerships, and manage the Lab personnel participating in the WIFIRE Lab operational programs.  The incumbent will also work with the Research and Product branches of the WIFIRE Lab to identify gaps between practice and research, implement the work above, and contribute to development of a roadmap for development.  The incumbent will also develop partnerships and work with other initiatives at UCSD that require problem solving using geospatial and remote sensing data (e. g. , BigPixel Initiative and Study of Mothers and Infants (SOMI) ) through the WorDS Center.
